summary: This document is a series of internal communications from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's status and complaints in the days before his death. It details his psychological observation, physical complaints (numbness in arm and neck), sleep apnea issues, and the plan to return him to the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Epstein's Medical Complaints and Observation
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein complained of numbness in his right arm and neck. A nurse saw him. He was placed on psychological observation.

events.title: Housing Decision and CPAP Machine
events.description: Epstein, while psychologically stable, requested to stay in a 'safe' area due to sleep apnea and physical complaints. He was scheduled to receive a CPAP machine and was told he would be returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) the next day.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was on psychological observation at MCC New York on July 28-29, 2019.
Epstein complained of significant physical symptoms including numbness in his right arm and neck, and an inability to make a fist.
Epstein cited sleep apnea as potentially impairing his memory regarding a prior neck injury and was scheduled to receive a CPAP machine.

Prison officials denied Epstein's request to remain in a 'safe' hospital area for comfort, stating there were no mental health issues precluding his return to the SHU, where he would be placed in a 'safe situation'.
The document records the official plan to transition Epstein from psychological observation back to the SHU on July 30, 2019.
